proverbs.textDari: با یک دست دو تربوز نمی‌توان گرفت
proverbs.textPashto: په یوه لاس دو هیندوانی نه شي نیول کېدای
proverbs.translationEn: You cannot hold two watermelons in one hand
proverbs.meaning: You cannot do two difficult tasks at once.

proverbs.textDari: هر که بامش بیش، برفش بیشتر
proverbs.textPashto: څوک چې کور یې لوړ وي، واوره یې زیاته وي
proverbs.translationEn: The higher the roof, the more snow it collects
proverbs.meaning: Greater responsibilities come with greater status.

proverbs.textDari: دوست آنست که گیرد دست دوست
proverbs.textPashto: ملګری هغه دی چې د ملګري لاس ونیسي
proverbs.translationEn: A friend is one who takes a friend's hand
proverbs.meaning: A true friend supports you in times of need.

proverbs.textPashto: په ارام روان شه، روغ ورسېږه
proverbs.meaning: Patience and care lead to better outcomes.

proverbs.textDari: از کوزه همان برون تراود که در اوست
proverbs.textPashto: له کوزې هغه راوځي چې په کې دننه وي
proverbs.translationEn: What comes out of the jug is what’s inside it
proverbs.meaning: A person's true nature is revealed by their actions.

proverbs.textDari: شجاعت در میدان جنگ معلوم می‌شود
proverbs.translationEn: Courage is proven on the battlefield
proverbs.meaning: True bravery is shown in challenging situations.

proverbs.textDari: چراغ که دو باشد، روشن‌تر است
proverbs.textPashto: چراغ که دو وي، روښانه وي
proverbs.translationEn: Two lamps are brighter than one
proverbs.meaning: Collaboration yields better results than working alone.

proverbs.translationEn: One flower does not bring spring
proverbs.meaning: A single effort is not enough to achieve great change.

proverbs.textDari: سگ زنده بهتر از شیر مرده است
proverbs.textPashto: ژوندی سپي له مړ زمري غوره دی
proverbs.translationEn: A living dog is better than a dead lion
proverbs.meaning: Survival and humility are more valuable than prideful defeat.

proverbs.textDari: تا نباشد چیزکی، مردم نگویند چیزها
proverbs.textPashto: تر څو چې یو څه نه وي، خلک به څه نه وايي
proverbs.translationEn: If there is nothing, people will say nothing
proverbs.meaning: Gossip arises only when there is some truth or action to fuel it.
